items.title: The Ruskin Journal
items.content: In addition to writing, editing, and curating for the magazine's website, promoting the magazine to students, working with local businesses, hosting events, and conducting interviews, I also led several other projects (somehow), including:

sub-items.title: ruskinjournal.com
sub-items.content: a re-design of the magazine's website.

sub-items.title: Third Edition Annual
sub-items.content: the magazine's third printed annual containing some of the best, most highly-rated articles published over the previous academic year (2019-20).

items.title: Esperus Systems
items.content: In addition to providing both first- and second-line support to the company's business clients, I also led the development on a number of different full-stack projects, including:

sub-items.title: Esperus CMS
sub-items.content: a custom web content management system.

sub-items.title: Esperus CLS
sub-items.content: a custom help desk ticketing system.

sub-items.title: B2B Integrations
sub-items.content: integrations between the company's wholesale clients and it's custom stock management system.

items.title: MSX International
items.content: As I began to learn the ropes, I also began to work on a wide variety of different projects, including:

sub-items.title: Kaleidoscope
sub-items.content: a custom web content management system with built-in data visualisation tools.

sub-items.title: Dealership Sales Portals
sub-items.content: a set of custom web front-ends built with Kaleidoscope for clients such as Subaru and Ford.

sub-items.title: Data Transformation Tools
sub-items.content: a graphical application to help transform XML-formated data into a proprietary format.

items.title: Scribe
items.content: An alternative word processor that uses 'content blocks' to break-down documents into 'cards and stacks'. Written in JavaScript (NodeJS) and Electron.

items.title: Noyau
items.content: Forked from an [abandoned open-source project](https://github.com/teejee2008/ukuu), Noyau manages kernel updates for Ubuntu-based distributions. Written in Vala and GTK for the Ubuntu (18.04+) desktop.

items.title: Night Blights
items.content: A student project turned commercial product - Night Blights is an indie horror game to which I contributed both time and testing during it's development. It has been released on Steam.
